(a) {@item studded leather armor|phb} or (b) {@item scale mail|phb} armor

entries: Verletzt, aber entschlossen und mit schweißnassem Gesicht fährt der Halb-Ork mit einem Finger über seine Wunden und zeichnet eine leuchtende, rubinrote Glyphe in die Luft. Er ergreift das schwerelose, vollendete Siegel und dreht es, um dunkle magische Energien freizusetzen, die nach vorne schießen und das Ungetüm aus seinen eigenen Adern heraus verfluchen, um die Chancen zu verbessern.

Eine geheimnisvolle Halbelfin in einem abgewetzten Umhang und einer robusten Lederrüstung untersucht vorsichtig eine grausige Szene am Straßenrand, ihre Augen blitzen vor Erkennen, als sie die Überreste des Massakers betrachtet. Der Überlebende, der sie vorsichtig angeheuert hat, zuckt zusammen, als die Halbelfin plötzlich auf die Füße schießt, sicher in dem Wissen, wer der Täter ist, wo er zu Hause ist und wie wenig Zeit bleibt, ihn zu finden.

Die Nase des Halblings nimmt den stechenden Geruch der drohenden Gefahr auf, als sie das Schaben von Knochen und Klauen auf dem nahen Stein hört, als sie in die lichtlosen Kammern aus altem Staub und leisem Geflüster tritt. Sie zuckt zusammen, als sie ihre Klinge über ihre Handfläche gleiten lässt. Der Stahl verwandelt ihr Blut in glühende Runen mächtiger Magie, und ihr Schwert wird plötzlich von arkanen Flammen umhüllt, die das Fleisch ihrer Feinde brennen und verzehren wollen.

Die oft gefürchteten oder missverstandenen Blutjäger sind kluge, arkane Krieger, die ihre Essenz mit den dunklen Kreaturen, die sie jagen, verbunden haben, um sich besser an ihre Beute anzuschleichen und zu überleben. Bewaffnet mit den Riten der verbotenen Blutmagie und der Bereitschaft, ihre eigene Vitalität und Menschlichkeit für die Sache zu opfern, schützen sie die Reiche aus den Schatten heraus, stets wachsam, um nicht zu den gleichen Monstern zu werden, die sie jagen.

entries.name: Sacrifice to Preserve Life
entries: Während die meisten klassischen Schulen des magischen Studiums bekannt und weithin respektiert sind, sind die weniger raffinierten und makabren Beschwörungen der Blutmagie für den Großteil der zivilisierten Welt seit langem verboten und verloren. Die Blutjäger haben sich diese Techniken abseits der urteilenden Augen der Gesellschaft zurückerobert, da sie die esoterische Natur der Blutmagie als wirksam gegen das Böse erachten, das sich oft den göttlichen Mächten widersetzt, die seit jeher die Grenze halten.

Durch sorgfältiges Studium und Übung haben die Blutjäger die Riten des Bluthandwerks in ihre Kampffähigkeiten integriert, indem sie einen Teil ihrer Gesundheit einbüßen, um ihre Waffen mit mächtiger Blutmagie zu erfüllen und die Elemente zu beschwören, die ihre Schläge einhüllen.

Sie können ein arkanes Brandzeichen in den Körper ihrer Beute einbrennen, das die Fähigkeiten ihres Gegners behindert und seine Aggression bestraft, oder sie können ihre Feinde mit einem Blutfluch belegen und ihren Körper von innen heraus manipulieren. Diese geschickten Krieger sind bereit, alles zu erleiden, was nötig ist, um den Sieg zu erringen, und haben sich zu einer mächtigen Kraft im Kampf gegen die Schrecken geschmiedet, die die Unschuldigen bedrohen.

entries.name: A Monster to Fight Monsters
entries: Ob es nun der Wunsch ist, in einer gefährlichen Welt etwas zu verändern, das Bedürfnis, sich für ein erlittenes Unrecht zu rächen, die Inspiration, die man durch die seltsamen und mächtigen Techniken eines anderen Blutjägers erhält, oder einfach die Suche nach einem Platz, an den man in einer gefühllosen Welt gehört - die Gründe, warum man den Fluch des Jägers auf sich nimmt und sich für dieses Leben entscheidet, sind vielfältig. Wenn man sich einem Orden von Blutjägern anschließt, schließt man sich auch einer engen Familie an, die durch den Dienst aneinander und an der gemeinsamen Sache verbunden ist. Für viele ist dies die einzige Familie, die sie kennen oder die sie verlassen haben, so dass die Verwandtschaft zwischen den Mitgliedern eines Ordens ein fast unzerstörbares Band ist.

Außerhalb der Grenzen des Ordens ist das Leben eines Blutjägers jedoch oft nicht einfach. Die Rituale des Fluch des Jägers führen regelmäßig zu sichtbaren Veränderungen, die das gemeine Volk verunsichern, und das Miterleben von Hämokunst kann selbst bei den gelehrtesten Gelehrten abergläubische Angst hervorrufen. Während einige Gesellschaften die guten Taten der Orden akzeptieren, verbergen viele Blutjäger ihre Natur öffentlich, es sei denn, es ist absolut notwendig, denn sie fühlen sich in der Wildnis und den Einöden der Welt, wo die Orden üblicherweise trainieren, wohler. Dennoch ist die beste Arbeit, die ein Blutjäger leisten kann, in der Regel die Arbeit an den Armen und Wehrlosen am Rande der Gesellschaft, an denen, die anfällig für die verderbliche Wirkung von Unholden und dunklen Absichten sind. Der Gefahr der Verunglimpfung trotzend, waten diese dunklen Beschützer durch die Zivilisation und verdienen ihr Geld als Söldner oder Kopfgeldjäger, immer auf der Suche nach Anzeichen für etwas Ruchloseres unter der Oberfläche.

Wenn ein Blutjäger diesen Weg wählt, hat er unwiderruflich einen Teil von sich selbst für seine Sache gegeben, physisch, emotional und manchmal auch moralisch. Die Orden der Blutjäger praktizieren ihre eigenen, einzigartigen Ideale und Methoden, wobei sie oft Techniken mit dunklen Ursprüngen anwenden, die die Stärke und den Willen dieser Wächter auf die Probe stellen. Viele ringen mit der Angst, diesen Kampf zu verlieren, so dass ein Leben der Disziplin und Wachsamkeit ihre Reisen bestimmt, wenn sie auf der Suche nach gleichgesinnten Abenteurern und dem Geflüster über dunkle Taten durch die Lande ziehen.

entries.name: Creating a Blood Hunter
entries: Wenn du einen Blutjäger erschaffst, sind die wichtigsten Aspekte deines Charakters die Frage, warum du zu diesem Lebensstil getrieben wurdest und warum du alles aufgeben willst, um dich in der Dunkelheit mit den Übeln, die du jagst, zu suhlen? Hast du einen geliebten Menschen an eine teuflische Bestie verloren und möchtest nun verhindern, dass andere das gleiche Schicksal erleiden? Suchst du nach einem Sinn und Geborgenheit und hast dies in dem Orden gefunden, der dich aufgenommen hat? Hast du schon immer eine Saat der Dunkelheit in dir getragen und suchst nach Verwandten, die über dich wachen und verhindern, dass du ihr erliegst? Warst du einst ein heiliger Krieger, der von seinem Glauben abfiel und verstoßen wurde, aber immer noch danach trachtest, dich der Sache des Schutzes der Unschuldigen zu widmen? Oder bist du ein Verbrecher mit einer dunklen Vergangenheit, der Wiedergutmachung leisten will und dieses Leben als Weg der Buße wählt?

Welche Beziehung haben Sie zu den Kräften der Hämokunst und den Fähigkeiten, die sie Ihnen zu verleihen verspricht, wenn Sie ihrer Beherrschung näher kommen? Respektieren und fürchten Sie die uralte Kraft, die durch Ihre Adern fließt, und nutzen Sie sie nur, wenn es nötig ist? Erfreuen Sie sich an der Kraft, die sie Ihnen bietet, und nutzen Sie Ihre Gaben frei? Sind Sie besorgt, dass der Aberglaube recht hat und diese Kraft Sie schließlich in eines der Monster verwandelt, die Sie jagen? Oder haben Sie durch Ihr Studium die Gewissheit erlangt, den Geist über die Materie zu beherrschen, und sind sich sicher, dass Sie diese Gaben nutzen können, um eine hellere Morgenröte heraufzubeschwören?

Bedenken Sie auch, dass ein Blutjäger zwar einem Orden angehört, viele aber auf eigene Faust losziehen, um ihre beste Arbeit zu leisten. Was hat Sie dazu gebracht, den Komfort Ihres Ordens zu verlassen? Haben Sie die Absicht, zurückzukehren, oder haben Sie beschlossen, dass Sie in der jenseitigen Welt mehr zu lernen haben? Was suchst du bei anderen Abenteurern, die dir helfen können, deine Ziele zu erreichen?

Während die meisten Blutjäger einem guten oder neutralen Weg folgen, sind einige der dunklen, verführerischen Seite des Bluthandwerks verfallen und nutzen ihre Fähigkeiten für egoistische und böse Zwecke. Diese Abweichler werden immer aus dem Orden geworfen und oft zusammen mit den Kreaturen gejagt, die sie einst zu töten ausgebildet wurden.

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: Du kannst schnell einen Blutjäger erstellen, wenn du die folgenden Vorschläge befolgst. Wähle als erstes Stärke oder Geschicklichkeit als höchsten Fähigkeitswert, je nachdem, ob du dich auf Nahkampfwaffen oder Bogenschießen (oder Finessenwaffen) konzentrieren willst. Wähle Intelligenz als nächsthöhere Fähigkeit, wenn du dich auf die Wirkung von Blutflüchen und mystischer Macht konzentrieren willst. Wähle als Nächstes eine höhere Konstitution, da du zusätzliche Trefferpunkte haben möchtest, die du für deinen purpurnen Ritus oder die Verstärkung von Blutflüchen verwenden kannst. Wähle dann den {@background urchin} oder {@background soldier} Hintergrund.

entries.name: Blood Hunter Multiclassing
entries: Wenn ihr euch in einen Blutjäger verwandeln wollt, sind die Voraussetzungen und Fähigkeiten, die ihr dafür benötigt, unten aufgeführt.

entries.name: Ability Score Minimum
entries: Stärke 13 oder Geschicklichkeit 13, und Intelligenz 13

entries.name: Proficiencies Gained
entries: Leichte Rüstung, mittlere Rüstung, Schilde, einfache Waffen, Kampfwaffen, Alchemistenbedarf.

entries.name: Proficiencies Gained
entries: Wenn du den Orden der Profanen Seele mit Hexenmeister-Stufen kombinierst, addiere ein Drittel deiner Blutjäger-Stufen (abgerundet) zu deiner Hexenmeister-Stufe und konsultiere die Hexenmeister-Progressionstabelle im Handbuch des Spielers für die Gesamtzahl der Zauberplätze, bekannten Zaubertricks und Zauberplatz-Stufe.

fluff.name: Blood Hunter

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of the Anxious
entries: Als Bonusaktion verstärkst du das Adrenalin im Körper einer Kreatur, die sich im Umkreis von 30 Fuß um dich herum befindet, und machst sie dadurch anfällig für einen starken Einfluss. Bis zum Ende deines nächsten Zuges haben alle Kreaturen einen Vorteil auf Charisma (Einschüchterung)-Prüfungen, die gegen die Zielkreatur gerichtet sind.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: The next Wisdom saving throw the target has to make before this curse ends has disadvantage.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of Binding
entries: As a bonus action, you can attempt to bind a creature you can see within 30 feet of you that is no more than one size larger than you. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have their speed be reduced to 0 and they can't use reactions until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: This curse lasts for 1 minute and can affect a creature regardless of their size category. At the end of each of its turns, the cursed creature can make another Strength saving throw. On a success, this curse ends.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of Bloated Agony
entries: As a bonus action, you curse a creature that you can see within 30 feet of you to painfully swell until the end of your next turn. For the duration of this curse, the creature has disadvantage on Strength and Dexterity ability checks, and suffers 1d8 necrotic damage if it makes more than one melee or ranged attack during its turn.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: This curse lasts for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns, the cursed creature can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, this curse ends.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of Corrosion
entries: As a bonus action, a creature within 30 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw or become poisoned. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Constitution saving throw. On a success, the curse ends.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: The cursed creature suffers 4d6 necrotic damage, and suffers this damage again every time it fail sits Constitution saving throw to end this curse at the end of its turn.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of the Exorcist
entries: As a bonus action, you can choose one creature you can see within 30 feet of you that is charmed, frightened, or possessed. The target creature is no longer charmed, frightened, or possessed.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: The creature that charmed, frightened, or possessed the target of your curse suffers 3d6 psychic damage and must make a Wisdom saving throw or be stunned until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of Exposure
entries: When a creature you can see within 30 feet is hit with an attack or spell, you can use your reaction to temporarily weaken their resilience against it. Until the end of the turn, the target loses their resistance to the damage types of the triggering attack or spell.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: The target instead loses invulnerability to the damage types of the triggering attack or spell, having resistance to them until the end of the turn.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of the Eyeless
entries: When a creature you can see within 30 feet of you makes an attack roll, you can use your reaction to roll one hemocraft die and subtract the number rolled from the creature's attack roll. You can choose to use this feature after the creature's roll, but before the DM determines whether the attack roll succeeds. The creature is immune if it is immune to blindness.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: You apply this curse to all of the creature's attack rolls until the end of the turn. You roll a new hemocraft die for each affected attack.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of the Fallen Puppet
entries: When a creature you can see within 30 feet drops to 0 hit points, you can use your reaction to make that creature immediately makes a single weapon attack against a target of your choice within its attack range.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: You can first move the cursed creature up to half their speed, and you grant a bonus to the cursed creature's attack roll equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1).

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of the Howl
entries: As an action, you unleash a blood-curdling howl. Each creature within 30 feet of you that can hear you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you until the end of your next turn. If they fail their saving throw by 5 or more, they are stunned while frightened in this way. A creature that succeeds on this saving throw is immune to this blood curse for the next 24 hours. You can choose any number of creatures you can see to be unaffected by this howl.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: The range of this curse increases to 60 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of the Marked
entries: As a bonus action, you can mark a creature within 30 feet of you. Until the end of your turn, you roll an additional hemocraft die whenever you deal rite damage to the target.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: The next attack roll you make against the target before the end of your turn has advantage.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of the Muddled Mind
entries: As a bonus action, you curse a creature that you can see within 30 feet of you that is concentrating on a spell. That creature has disadvantage on the next Constitution saving throw it must make to maintain concentration before the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: The cursed creature has disadvantage on all Constitution saving throws made to maintain concentration of spells until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of the Souleater
entries: When a creature that isn't a construct or undead is reduced to 0 hit points within 30 feet of you, you can use your reaction to usher their soul to your patron in exchange for power. Until the end of your next turn, your weapon attacks have advantage.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: In addition, you regain an expended warlock spellslot. Once you've amplified this blood curse, you must finish a long rest before you can amplify it again.

optionalfeature.name: Aether
entries: You gain a flying speed of 20 feet for 1 hour. As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on Strength and Dexterity ability checks for 1 hour.

optionalfeature.name: Cruelty
entries: When you use the Attack action, you can make an additional weapon attack as a bonus action. As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Precision
entries: Your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19-20. As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on Strength saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Reconstruction
entries: For 1 hour, at the start of each of your turns, you regain hit points equal to your proficiency bonus if you have at least 1 hit point but no more than half of your hit points left. As a side effect, your speed decreases by 10ft for 1hour.

optionalfeature.name: Alluring
entries: Your skin and voice become malleable, allowing you to slightly enhance your appearance and presence. You have advantage on Charisma ability checks. As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on initiative rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Celerity
entries: Your Dexterity score increases by 3, as does your Dexterity maximum. This bonus increases by 1 at 11th level (+4) and 18th level (+5). As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Conversant
entries: You gain advantage on Intelligence ability checks. As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on Wisdom ability checks.

optionalfeature.name: Deftness
entries: You gain advantage on Dexterity ability checks. As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on Wisdom ability checks.

optionalfeature.name: Embers
entries: You gain resistance to fire damage. As a side effect, you gain vulnerability to cold damage.

optionalfeature.name: Gelid
entries: You gain resistance to cold damage. As a side effect, you gain vulnerability to fire damage.

optionalfeature.name: Impermeable
entries: You gain resistance to piercing damage. As a side effect, you gain vulnerability to slashing damage.

optionalfeature.name: Mobile
entries: You are immune to the grappled and restrained conditions. At 11th level, you also are immune to the paralyzed condition. As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on Strength ability checks.

optionalfeature.name: Nighteye
entries: You gain darkvision for up to 60 feet. If you already have darkvision, this increases its range by 60 additional feet. As a side effect, you gain sunlight sensitivity (detailed in the Dark Elf section on page 24 in the Player's Handbook).

optionalfeature.name: Percipient
entries: You gain advantage on Wisdom ability checks. As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on Charisma ability checks.

optionalfeature.name: Potency
entries: Your Strength score increases by 3, as does your Strength maximum. This bonus increases by 1 at 11th level (+4) and 18th level (+5). As a side effect, you have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Rapidity
entries: Your speed increases by 10feet. At 15th level, your speed increases by 15 feet instead. As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on Intelligence ability checks.

optionalfeature.name: Sagacity
entries: Your Intelligence score increases by 3, as does your Intelligence maximum. This bonus increases by 1 at 11th level (+4) and 18th level (+5). As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on Charisma saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Shielded
entries: You gain resistance to slashing damage. As a side effect, you gain vulnerability to bludgeoning damage.

optionalfeature.name: Unbreakable
entries: You gain resistance to bludgeoning damage. As a side effect, you gain vulnerability to piercing damage.

optionalfeature.name: Vermillion
entries: You gain an additional use of your Blood Maledict feature. As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on death saving throws.

classFeature.name: Hunter's Bane
entries: Beginning at 1st level, you have survived the Hunter's Bane, a dangerous, long-guarded ritual that alters your life's blood, forever binding you to the darkness and honing your senses against it. You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) checks to track fey, fiends, or undead, as well as on Intelligence ability checks to recall information about them.

The Hunter's Bane also empowers your body to control and shape hemocraft magic, using your own blood and life essence to fuel your abilities. Some of your features require your target to make a saving throw to resist the feature's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

classFeature.name: Blood Maledict
entries: At 1st level, you gain the ability to channel, and sometimes sacrifice, a part of your vital essence to curse and manipulate creatures through hemocraft magic. You gain one blood curse of your choice, detailed in the "{@filter Blood Curses|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=Blood Curse}" section at the end of the class description. You learn one additional blood curse of your choice, and you can choose one of the blood curses you know and replace it with another blood curse, at 6th, 10th, 14th, and 18th level.

When you use your Blood Maledict, you choose which curse to invoke. While invoking a blood curse, but before it affects the target, you can choose to amplify the curse by losing a number of hit points equal to one roll of your hemocraft die, as shown in the Hemocraft Die column of the Blood Hunter table. An amplified curse gains an additional effect, noted in the curse's description. Creatures that do not have blood in their bodies are immune to blood curses, unless you have amplified the curse.

You can use this feature once. Beginning at 6th level, you can use your Blood Maledict feature twice, at 13th level you can use it three times between rests, and at 17th level, you can use it four times between rests. You regain all expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: At 2nd level, you adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can't take the same Fighting Style option more than once, even if you get to choose again.

entries.name: Archery
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.

entries.name: Dueling
entries: When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.

entries.name: Great Weapon Fighting
entries: When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a melee weapon that you are wielding with two hands, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2. The weapon must have the two-handed or versatile property for you to gain this benefit.

entries.name: Two-Weapon Fighting
entries: When you engage in two-weapon fighting, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack.

classFeature.name: Crimson Rite
entries: At 2nd level, you learn to invoke a rite of hemocraft within your weapon at the cost of your own vitality. Choose one rite from the Primal Rites list be low to learn.

As a bonus action, you activate a crimson rite on a single weapon with the elemental energy of a known rite of your choice that lasts until you finish a short or long rest, or if you aren't holding the weapon at the end of your turn. When you activate a rite , you lose a number of hit points equal to one roll of your hemocraft die,as shown in the Hemocraft Die column of the Blood Hunter table.

While active, attacks from this weapon deal an additional {@dice 1d4} damage of the chosen rite's type. This damage is magical, and increases as you gain levels as a blood hunter, as shown in the Hemocraft Die column of the Blood Hunter table. A weapon can only hold a single active rite at a time.
You learn an additional Primal Rite of your choice at 7th level, and choose an Esoteric Rite to learn at 14th level.

entries.name: Primal Rites
entries: Choose from the following:

entries.name: Rite of the Flame
entries: Your rite damage is fire damage.

entries.name: Rite of the Frozen
entries: Your rite damage is cold damage.

entries.name: Rite of the Storm
entries: Your rite damage is lightning damage.

entries.name: Esoteric Rites
entries: Choose from the following:

entries.name: Rite of the Dead
entries: Your rite damage is necrotic damage.

entries.name: Rite of the Oracle
entries: Your rite damage is psychic damage.

entries.name: Rite of the Roar
entries: Your rite damage is thunder damage.

classFeature.name: Blood Hunter Order
entries: At 3rd level, you commit to an order of blood hunter martial focus. Choose Order of the Ghostslayer, Order of the Profane Soul, Order of the Mutant, or Order of the Lycan, all detailed at the end of the class description. The order you choose grants you features at 3rd level, and again at 7th, 11th, 15th, and 18th level.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Brand of Castigation
entries: At 6th level, whenever you damage a creature with your Crimson Rite feature, you can choose to sear an arcane brand of hemocraft magic into it (requires no action). You always know the direction to the branded creature, and each time the branded creature deals damage to you or a creature you can see within 5 feet of you, the branded creature suffers psychic damage equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1 damage).

Your brand lasts until you dismiss it, or you apply a brand to another creature. Your brand counts as a spell for the purposes of {@spell dispel magic|phb}, and the spell level is equal to half of your blood hunter level (maximum of 9th level spell).
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Blood Maledict Improvement
entries: Beginning at 6th level, you can use your Blood Maledict feature twice between rests.

classFeature.name: Order feature
entries: At 7th level, you gain a feature granted by your Blood Hunter Order.

classFeature.name: Primal Rite
entries: At 7th level, you learn an additional Primal Rite.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Grim Psychometry
entries: When you reach 9th level, you have a supernatural talent for discerning the history surrounding mysterious objects or places touched by evil. When making an Intelligence ({@skill History}) check to recall information about a darker past surrounding an object you are touching, or a location you are present in, you have advantage on the roll. The information gleaned often leans towards the more sinister influences of the past, and sometimes conveys visions of things previously unknown to the character on higher rolls.

classFeature.name: Dark Augmentation
entries: Upon reaching 10th level, arcane blood magic suffuses your body, permanently reinforcing your resilience. Your speed increases by 5 feet, and whenever you make a Strength, Dexterity, or Constitution saving throw, you gain a bonus to the saving throw equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of one).

classFeature.name: Order feature
entries: At 11th level, you gain a feature granted by your Blood Hunter Order.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Brand of Tethering
entries: Starting at 13th level, the psychic damage from your Brand of Castigation feature increases to twice your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 2). In addition, a branded creature can't take the Dash action, and if a creature branded by you attempts to teleport or leave their current plane via ability, spell, or portal, they take 4d6 psychic damage and must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the teleport or plane shift fails.

classFeature.name: Blood Maledict Improvement
entries: Beginning at 13th level, you can use your Blood Maledict feature three times between rests.

classFeature.name: Hardened Soul
entries: When you reach 14th level, you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed and frightened.

classFeature.name: Esoteric Rite
entries: At 14th level, you learn a Esoteric Rite.

classFeature.name: Order feature
entries: At 15th level, you gain a feature granted by your Blood Hunter Order.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Blood Maledict Improvement
entries: Beginning at 17th level, you can use your Blood Maledict feature four times between rests.

classFeature.name: Order feature
entries: At 18th level, you gain a feature granted by your Blood Hunter Order.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Sanguine Mastery
entries: Upon becoming 20th level, you honed your control over blood magic, mitigating your sacrifice and empowering your capability. Once per turn, whenever a blood hunter feature requires you to roll a hemocraft die, you can choose to reroll the die and choose which result to use.
In addition, whenever you score a critical hit with a weapon attack empowered by your Crimson Rite, you regain one expended use of your Blood Maledict feature.

subclassFeature.name: Order of the Ghostslayer
entries: The Order of the Ghostslayer is the oldest of the orders, having originally rediscovered the secrets of blood magic and refined them for combat against the scourge of undeath. ghostslayers seek out and study the moment of death, obsessing over the mysteries of the transition and how it can become corrupted by unholy powers to rise once more. Tuning their abilities to annihilate such abominations, these zealous blood hunters seek out the sources of such necromantic energies, intent to destroy them wherever they arise.

subclassFeature.name: Rite of the Dawn
entries: When you join this order at 3rd level, you learn the Rite of the Dawn esoteric rite (detailed below).

entries.name: Rite of the Dawn
entries: Your rite damage is radiant damage. While the rite is active, you gain the following benefits:

items: Your weapon sheds bright light out to a radius of 20 feet.
You have resistance to necrotic damage.
Your weapon deals one additional hemocraft die when you hit an undead.

subclassFeature.name: Curse Specialist
entries: Beginning at 3rd level, your ancient order teaches advanced mastery over blood curses. You gain an additional use of your Blood Maledict feature. In addition, your blood curses can target any creature, whether it has blood or not.

subclassFeature.name: Ethereal Step
entries: Upon reaching 7th level, at the start of your turn, if you aren't incapacitated, you can choose to magically step into the veil between the planes. You can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain, as well as see and affect creatures and objects on the Ethereal Plane. You take {@dice 1d10} force damage if you end your turn inside an object. If you are inside an object when this feature ends, you are immediately shunted to the nearest unoccupied space that you can occupy and take force damage equal to twice the number of feet you moved. This feature lasts for a number of rounds equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1 round).
You can use this feature once. Beginning at 15th level, you can use your Ethereal Step feature twice between rests. You regain all expended uses when you finish a short or longrest.

subclassFeature.name: Brand of Sundering
entries: Beginning at 11th level, your Brand of Castigation now exposes a fragment of your foe's essence, leaving them vulnerable to your Crimson Rite. Whenever you damage a branded creature with your Crimson Rite, you roll one additional hemocraft die. In addition, the branded creature can't move through creatures or objects.

subclassFeature.name: Blood Curse of the Exorcist
entries: At 15th level, you've honed your hemocraft to tear wicked influence from your allies, punishing those who would infiltrate their body and mind. You gain the {@optfeature Blood Curse of the Exorcist|BH2020} for your Blood Maledict feature. This doesn't count against your number of blood curses known.

subclassFeature.name: Rite Revival
entries: Upon reaching 18th level, you learn to protect your fading life by absorbing your blood rite. When you are reduced to 0 hit points while you have an active Crimson Rite, but don't die outright, the rite ends and you drop to 1 hit point instead. If you have multiple rites active, you choose which one ends.

subclassFeature.name: Order of the Profane Soul
entries: Those who have taken to the Order of the Profane Soul have seen the limits of hemocraft against some of the most ancient and cruel fiends and terrors of the world. Unable to pursue beings of such power, creatures able to vanish amongst the nobles without a trace, or bend the mind of the most stalwart warrior with but a glance, this order trusted in the irresilience and delved into this same well of corrupting arcane knowledge, making pacts with lesser evils to better combat the greater. While they may have traded a part of themselves, members of this order believe the power gained far outweighs the price, for even devils now quake when they know they've drawn the attention of the Order of the Profane Soul.

subclassFeature.name: Otherworldly Patron
entries: When you reach 3rd level, you strike a bargain with an otherworldly being of your choice: the Archfey, the Fiend, or the Great Old One, each detailed in the Player's Handbook, the Undying within the Sword Coast Adventurer's Guide, and the Celestial or Hexblade in Xanathar's Guide to Everything. Your choice augments some of your order features.

subclassFeature.name: Pact Magic
entries: When you reach 3rd level, you can augment your combat techniques with the ability to cast spells. See {@book chapter 10|PHB|10} of the Player's Handbook for the general rules of spell casting and chapter 11 of the Player's Handbook for the {@filter Warlock spell list|spells|class=warlock}.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the {@filter Warlock spell list|spells|class=warlock}. You learn an additional warlock cantrip of your choice at 10th level.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Profane Soul Spellcasting table shows how many spell slots you have. The table also shows what the level of those slots is; all of your spell slots are the same level. To cast one of your {@filter Warlock spells|spells|class=warlock} of 1st level or higher, you must expend a spell slot. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a short or long rest.
For example, when you are 8th level, you have two 2nd-level spell slots. To cast the 1st-level spell witch bolt, you must spend one of those slots, and you cast it as a 2nd-level spell.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st Level and Higher
entries: At 3rd level, you know two 1st-level spells of your choice from the {@filter Warlock spell list|spells|class=warlock}.

The Spells Known column of the Profane Soul table shows when you learn more {@filter Warlock spells|spells|class=warlock} of your choice of 1st level and higher. A spell you choose must be of a level no higher than what's shown in the table's Slot Level column for your level. When you reach 11th level, for example, you learn a new warlock spell, which can be 1st, 2nd, or 3rd level.

Additionally, when you gain a level in this class and order, you can choose one of the warlock spells you know and replace it with another spell from the warlock spell list, which also must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Intelligence is your spell casting ability for your warlock spells, so you use your Intelligence whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a warlock spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

subclassFeature.name: Rite Focus
entries: Beginning at 3rd level, your weapon becomes a core to your pact with your chosen dark patron. While you have an active Crimson Rite, you can use your weapon as a spellcasting focus (found in {@book chapter 5|PHB|5} of the Player's Handbook) for your warlock spells, and you gain a specific benefit based on your chosen pact (outlined below).

entries.name: The Archfey
entries: When you deal rite damage to a creature, it glows with faint light until the end of your next turn. For the duration, the creature can't benefit from half cover, three-quarters cover, or being invisible.

entries.name: The Fiend
entries: When you hit a creature with your Rite of the Flame, if you roll a 1 or 2 on your hemocraft die, you can reroll the die. If you do so, you must use the new roll.

entries.name: The Great Old One
entries: When you score a critical hit against a creature while using the weapon, that creature is frightened of you until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: The Undying
entries: Whenever you reduce a hostile creature to 0 hit points using a weapon, you regain a number of hit points equal to one roll of your hemocraft die.

entries.name: The Celestial
entries: You can expend a use of your Blood Maledict feature as a bonus action to heal one creature that you can see within 60 feet of you. They regain a number of hit points equal to one roll of your hemocraft die + your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1).

entries.name: The Hexblade
entries: Whenever you target a creature with a blood curse, your next attack against the cursed creature deals additional damage equal to your proficiency modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Mystic Frenzy
entries: Starting at 7th level, when you use your action to cast a cantrip, you can immediately make one weapon attack as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Revealed Arcana
entries: At 7th level, your dark patron grants you the rare use of a dangerous arcane spell based on your pact.

entries.name: The Archfey
entries: You can cast {@spell blur} once using a pact magic spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: The Fiend
entries: You can cast {@spell scorching ray} once using a pact magic spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: The Great Old One
entries: You can cast {@spell detect thoughts} once using a pact magic spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: The Undying
entries: You can cast {@spell blindness/deafness} once using a pact magic spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: The Celestial
entries: You can cast {@spell lesser restoration} once using a pact magic spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: The Hexblade
entries: You can cast {@spell branding smite} once using a pact magic spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Brand of the Sapping Scar
entries: Upon reaching 11th level, your Brand of Castigation feature now digs dark, arcane scars into your target, leaving them vulnerable to your magic. A creature branded by you has disadvantage on their saving throws against your warlock spells.

subclassFeature.name: Unsealed Arcana
entries: At 15th level, your patron grants you the rare use of an additional arcane spell based on your pact.

entries.name: The Archfey
entries: You can cast {@spell slow} once without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: The Fiend
entries: You can cast {@spell fireball} once without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: The Great Old One
entries: You can cast {@spell haste} once without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: The Undying
entries: You can cast {@spell bestow curse} once without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: The Celestial
entries: You can cast {@spell revivify} once without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: The Hexblade
entries: You can cast {@spell blink} once without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Blood Curse of the Souleater
entries: Starting at 18th level, you've learned to siphon the soul from your fallen prey. You gain the {@optfeature Blood Curse of the Souleater|BH2020} for your Blood Maledict feature. This does not count against your number of blood curses known.

subclassFeature.name: Order of the Mutant
entries: The process of the Hunter's Bane is a painful, scarring, and sometimes fatal experience. Those that survive find themselves irrevocably changed, enhanced. Some found this experience exalting, embracing the ability to alter one's own physiology through a combination of hemocraft and corrupted alchemy. Over generations of experimentation, a splinter order of blood hunters began to emerge, one that focused on brewing toxic elixirs to modify their capabilities in battle, altering their blood and, overtime, become something beyond what they once were. They called themselves the Order of the Mutant. Researching their targets to know their strengths and weaknesses, these blood hunters can alter their biology to be best prepared for the coming conflict.

subclassFeature.name: Formulas
entries: You begin to uncover forbidden alchemical formulas that temporarily alter your mental and physical abilities. Beginning at 3rd level, you choose to learn four mutagen formulas. Your {@filter formula options|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=Mutagen} are detailed at the end of this order description. You gain an additional formula at 7th level, 11th level, 15th level, and 18th level. Additionally, when you gain a new mutagen formula, you can choose one of the formulas you already know and replace it with a new mutagen formula.

subclassFeature.name: Mutagencraft
entries: At 3rd level, you can concoct a single mutagen when you finish a short or long rest. Starting at 7th level, the number of mutagens you can create when you finish a rest increases to two, and you can create three mutagens at 15th level.

As a bonus action you can consume a single mutagen, and the effects and side effects last until you finish a short or long rest, unless otherwise specified. While one or more mutagens are affecting you, you can use an action to focus and flush the toxins from your system, ending the effects and side effects of all mutagens.

Mutagens are designed for your biology and have no effect on other creatures. They are also unstable by nature, losing their potency over time and becoming inert if not used before you finish your next short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Mutagens
entries: These mutagens are presented in alphabetical order. You can learn a mutagen at the same time you meet its prerequisites.

entries.name: Aether (11th Level Required)
entries: You gain a flying speed of 20 feet for 1 hour. As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on Strength and Dexterity ability checks for 1 hour.

entries.name: Alluring
entries: Your skin and voice become malleable, allowing you to slightly enhance your appearance and presence. You have advantage on Charisma ability checks. As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on initiative rolls.

entries.name: Celerity
entries: Your Dexterity score increases by 3, as does your Dexterity maximum. This bonus increases by 1 at 11th level (+4) and 18th level (+5). As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws.

entries.name: Conversant
entries: You gain advantage on Intelligence ability checks. As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on Wisdom ability checks.

entries.name: Cruelty (11th level required)
entries: When you use the Attack action, you can make an additional weapon attack as a bonus action. As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.

entries.name: Deftness
entries: You gain advantage on Dexterity ability checks. As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on Wisdom ability checks.

entries.name: Embers
entries: You gain resistance to fire damage. As a side effect, you gain vulnerability to cold damage.

entries.name: Gelid
entries: You gain resistance to cold damage. As a side effect, you gain vulnerability to fire damage.

entries.name: Impermeable
entries: You gain resistance to piercing damage. As a side effect, you gain vulnerability to slashing damage.

entries.name: Mobile
entries: You are immune to the grappled and restrained conditions. At 11th level, you also are immune to the paralyzed condition. As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on Strength ability checks.

entries.name: Nighteye
entries: You gain darkvision for up to 60 feet. If you already have darkvision, this increases its range by 60 additional feet. As a side effect, you gain sunlight sensitivity (detailed in the Dark Elf section on page 24 in the Player's Handbook).

entries.name: Percipient
entries: You gain advantage on Wisdom ability checks. As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on Charisma ability checks.

entries.name: Potency
entries: Your Strength score increases by 3, as does your Strength maximum. This bonus increases by 1 at 11th level (+4) and 18th level (+5). As a side effect, you have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws.

entries.name: Precision (11th level required)
entries: Your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19-20. As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on Strength saving throws.

entries.name: Rapidity
entries: Your speed increases by 10feet. At 15th level, your speed increases by 15 feet instead. As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on Intelligence ability checks.

entries.name: Reconstruction (7th level required)
entries: For 1 hour, at the start of each of your turns, you regain hit points equal to your proficiency bonus if you have at least 1 hit point but no more than half of your hit points left. As a side effect, your speed decreases by 10ft for 1hour.

entries.name: Sagacity
entries: Your Intelligence score increases by 3, as does your Intelligence maximum. This bonus increases by 1 at 11th level (+4) and 18th level (+5). As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on Charisma saving throws.

entries.name: Shielded
entries: You gain resistance to slashing damage. As a side effect, you gain vulnerability to bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Unbreakable
entries: You gain resistance to bludgeoning damage. As a side effect, you gain vulnerability to piercing damage.

entries.name: Vermillion
entries: You gain an additional use of your Blood Maledict feature. As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on death saving throws.

subclassFeature.name: Strange Metabolism
entries: Beginning at 7th level, your body has begun to adapt to toxins and venoms, ignoring their corroding effects. You gain immunity to poison damage and the poisoned condition. In addition, you can instill a burst of adrenaline to temporarily resist the negative effects of a mutagen. As a bonus action, you can choose to ignore the side effect of a mutagen affecting you for 1 minute. Once you use this feature to resist side effects, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Brand of Axiom
entries: At 11th level, your hemocraft has altered your Brand of Castigation to enforce a foe's true nature. Any illusions disguising or making a creature invisible when you brand them end, and they can't benefit from such illusions while branded. If a creature branded by you is polymorphed or has changed shape, they must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or revert to their true form and be stunned until the end of your next turn. Whenever a branded creature attempts to polymorph or change shape, they must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or the attempt fails, and they are stunned until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Blood Curse of Corrosion
entries: Starting at 15th level, your blood curse can wrack a creature's body with terrible toxins. You gain the {@optfeature Blood Curse of Corrosion|BH2020} for your Blood Maledict feature. This does not count against your number of blood curses known.

subclassFeature.name: Exalted Mutation
entries: At 18th level, your body has adapted to produce your toxins naturally in a moment of need. As a reaction, you can choose one mutagen currently affecting you to flush from your system and end, then immediately have a mutagen you know the formula for take effect in its place. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1). You regain all uses of this feature after you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Order of the Lycan
entries: Of the many terrible curses that plague the realm, few are as ancient or as feared as Lycanthropy. Passed through blood, this affliction seeds a host with the savage strength and hunger for violence of a wicked beast. The Order of the Lycan is a proud order of blood hunters who undergo "The Taming," a ceremonial inflicting of lycanthropy from a senior member. These hunters then use their abilities to harness the power of the monster they harbor without losing themselves to it. Through intense honing of one's own willpower, combined with the secrets of the order's blood magic rituals, members learn to control and unleash their hybrid form for short periods of time. Enhanced physical prowess, unnatural resilience, and razor sharp claws make these warriors a terrible foe to any evil that crosses their path. Yet, no training is perfect, and without care and complete focus, even the greatest of blood hunters can temporarily lose themselves to the bloodlust.

subclassFeature.name: Heightened Senses
entries: Starting when you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you begin to adopt the improved abilities of a natural predator. You gain advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

subclassFeature.name: Hybrid Transformation
entries: Upon choosing this archetype at 3rd level, you begin to learn to control the lycanthropic curse that now lives in your blood. As a bonus action, you can transform into your hybrid form for up to 1 hour. You can speak, use equipment, and wear armor in this form. You can revert to your normal form earlier as a bonus action. You automatically revert to your normal form if you fall unconscious, drop to 0 hit points, or die. This feature replaces the rules for Lycanthropy within the Monster's Manual.
Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again. While you are transformed, you gain the following features:

entries.name: Feral Might
entries: You gain a +1 to melee damage rolls. This bonus increases by 1 at 11th level (+2) and 18th level (+3). You also have advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.

entries.name: Resilient Hide
entries: You have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks not made with silver weapons. While you are not wearing heavy armor, you gain a +1 bonus to your AC.

entries.name: Predatory Strikes
entries: Your can apply your Crimson Rite feature to your unarmed strikes. You can use Dexterity instead of Strength for the attack and damage rolls of your unarmed strikes. When you use the Attack action with an unarmed strike, you can make one unarmed strike as a bonus action. Your unarmed strikes deal {@damage 1d6} slashing damage. The damage increases to {@damage 1d8} at 11th level.

entries.name: Bloodlust
entries: If you begin your turn with no more than half of your maximum hit points, you must succeed on a DC 8 Wisdom saving throw or move directly towards the nearest creature to you and use the {@action Attack} action against that creature. You can choose whether or not to use your Extra Attack feature for this frenzied attack. If there is more than one possible target, roll to randomly determine the target. You then regain control for the remainder of your turn. If you are under an effect that prevents you from concentrating (like the barbarian's {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1} feature), you automatically fail this saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: The Onus of Lycanthropy
entries: Those inducted into the Order of the Lycan choose this path with conviction, understanding the terrible burden it is and the challenges it brings. Where most who embrace this curse grow wicked, mad, even murderous, these blood hunters accept the gifts of the beast while maintaining control through intense training and blood magic. These factors enable a member of the Order of the Lycan to prevent the spread of their curse through blood, should they wish to. One of the most sacred oaths of this order is to never infect another without the order's sanction.

Should a member of the Order of the Lycan be cured of the lycanthropic curse, it is a terrible shame on their name, the order, and those who carry the curse still. There have been passages written about members being cleansed against their will, but those brothers and sisters readily return to the order to undergo a renewed initiation of The Taming, reintroducing the curse to their bodies and restoring their honor.

Lycanthropy comes in many forms. Each version of the curse is bound to a specific beast: wolf, bear, tiger, boar, and rat are a few of the more well-known variations. The strain of the curse defines the beast a hybrid form will share, but the features the curse bestows remain relatively uniform across strains.

subclassFeature.name: Stalker's Prowess
entries: At 7th level, your speed increases by 10 feet. You also can add 10 feet to your long jump distance and 3 feet to your high jump distance. In addition, your hybrid form gains the Improved Predatory Strikes feature.

entries.name: Improved Predatory Strikes
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls made with your unarmed strikes. This bonus increases by 1 at 11th level (+2) and 18th level (+3). In addition, when you have an active Crimson Rite while in your hybrid form, your unarmed strikes are considered magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

subclassFeature.name: Advanced Transformation
entries: Starting at 11th level, you learn to unleash and control more of the beast within. You can use your Hybrid Transformation feature twice, regaining all expended uses when you finish a short or long rest. In addition, your hybrid form gains the Lycan Regeneration feature. Lycan Regeneration. At the start of each of your turns, you regain hit points equal to 1 + your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1) if you have at least 1 hit point and no more than half of your hit points left.

subclassFeature.name: Brand of the Voracious
entries: At 15th level, you have advantage on your Wisdom saving throws to maintain control of your bloodlust in hybrid form. In addition, your Brand of Castigation now binds your foe to your hunter's thirst for savagery. While in your hybrid form, your attacks have advantage against a creature branded by you.

subclassFeature.name: Hybrid Transformation Mastery
entries: At 18th level, you have wrestled your inner predator and master edit. You can use your Hybrid Transformation feature an unlimited number of times, and your hybrid form can now last indefinitely. You also gain the Blood Curse of the Howl for your Blood Maledict feature. This does not count against your number of blood curses known.

subclassFeatures: Blood Curse of the Exorcist|Blood Hunter|BH2020|Ghostslayer|BH2020|15

subclassFeatures: Order of the Profane Soul|Blood Hunter|BH2020|Profane Soul|BH2020|3
